intro: Aira cupaniana, commonly known as the panic grass, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and marshes. Its seeds are small and wind-dispersed, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. Aira cupaniana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and role in stabilizing soil.
